trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> objects.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerActionCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerActionCollection"></xref> class that has the specified initial size.
The size of the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object to add.
Removes all items from the collection.
Returns a value that indicates whether the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object is found in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Begins at the specified index and copies the collection items to the specified array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items that are copied from the collection.
The array must use zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array where copying starts.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
The number of items that the collection contains.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Returns the index of the specified item in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object to locate in the collection.
The index of value if the object is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified item into the collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index where the value must be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object to insert into the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the item that is at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the item to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object that is at the specified index.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified object from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerAction"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
`true` if item is successfully removed; otherwise, `false`.
This method also returns false if item was not found in the <xref href="System.Windows.TriggerActionCollection"></xref>.
Removes from the collection the item that is located at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items that are copied from the collection.
The array must use zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array where copying starts.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
true if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>; otherwise, false.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The zero-based index of the item to get or set.
The object that is at the specified index.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
